questions.question_text: A company is adopting a BYOD policy and is looking for a comprehensive solution to protect company information on user devices. Which of the following solutions would BEST support the policy?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Mobile device management (MDM) would be the best solution to support a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) policy and protect company information on user devices. MDM allows the company to manage and secure the devices that employees bring into the corporate environment. It provides capabilities such as enforcing security policies, configuring device settings, managing applications, and remotely monitoring and managing devices.

Selected Answer: A
MDM is the correct answer.

discussion.content: Initially, I chose Full Disk Encryption until I realised that it is also included in an MDM solution.

Selected Answer: A
MDM

FDE only protects data at rest. Employees using cloud / email would be using data in transit too.
B is the correct answer. Full disk encryption.

comments.content: FDE only protects data at rest. MDM is the answer.

Professor Messer covers this on his videos. Full-device encryption ensures that all data on the device is encrypted, making it unreadable without the proper decryption key, even if the device is lost or stolen. This is a fundamental security measure for protecting sensitive company information on BYOD devices. If a user's device is lost or compromised, the encrypted data remains secure. As such, full disk encryption is the best answer here.
